description: Single storey rear extension, loft conversion with rear dormer and front roof light
decision_conditions: The proposed development,by reason of the bulk and mass at roof level, in particular the size of the rear dormer and its excessive width across the extended roof, would appear as an unacceptably dominant and visually intrusive feature in the street scene and rear garden environment and be harmful to the appearance of the surrounding area, contrary to the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document, policies D1, D3 and D4 of The London Plan (2021) and Policies 7 and 26 of the Local Plan.

The proposed rear extension having an excessive depth, appear as an unacceptably dominant, incongruous and visually intrusive feature in the rear garden scene and by reason of its depth and close proximity to the neighbouring property at No. 41 Woodside Close, result in loss of light, loss of outlook and be a visually oppressive, dominant and un-neighbourly development contrary to the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document,  policies D1, D3 and D4 of The London Plan (2021) and Policies 7 and 26 of the Local Plan.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, it was necessary to issue a decision as close to the statutory timeframe as possible as opposed to seeking amendments which would have significantly delayed the application.
